Severance_Matrix__abstract_Object.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Severance_Matrix__abstract_ObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Severance_Matrix__abstract_Object.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: The instance of severance matrix that the data will be applied to.

Enhanced_Severance_Matrix_Data.description: The reference ID for the Severance Matrix.
The effective date for which the data in this web service will take take effect.

validation.validation: The effective date must be greater than or equal to [date], because this was the effective date used at creation.

Enhanced_Severance_Matrix_Data.description: The name of the Severance Matrix. Shows up when selecting a matrix in prompts.

validation.validation: Enter a unique name for the Severance Matrix. The name [name] is already in use.

Enhanced_Severance_Matrix_Data.description: If true, the matrix is considered inactive and won't show up as an option to select in Severance Packages.

Service_Duration_Severance_Matrix_Data.description: Days, Weeks, Months, or Years depending on the units used to define minimum and maximum length of service.

Service_Duration_Severance_Matrix_Entry_.description: This indicates the minimum years of service an employee must have to qualify for this entry.
This indicates the maximum years of service an employee must have to qualify for this entry.

Service_Duration_Severance_Matrix_Entry_.description: This indicates the Eligibility Rule that the employee must pass in order to qualify for this entry.
This indicates the duration for a Duration type entry only.
This indicates the minimum recommendation for the duration or length of service for the entry.
This indicates the maximum recommendation for the duration/length of service for the entry.

Service_Duration_Severance_Matrix_Data.description: The data for each entry in the matrix.

validation.validation: One or more Service Length ranges overlap.
The duration must be greater than or equal to minimum: [min] and less than or equal to maximum: [max].
Maximum Length of Service value must be greater than Minimum Length of Service value
Maximum duration must be greater than or equal to Minimum duration
Minimum and Maximum Length of Service values cannot both be blank or zero.
